Keywords: Animal , Brotherhood of Mutants , Marauders , Monster , Weapon X
Real Name: Victor Creed
Special Powers
RALLY (5): Opposing Attack Rolls. When Sabretooth uses Blades/Claws/Fangs, before rolling the d6 you may instead remove his RALLY die to use it as the result. (RALLY: Once per roll for each die in a finalized attack roll and for all characters with a matching RALLY die and trait color printed under their trait star, after resolutions you may choose a friendly character to gain a matching RALLY die. RALLY trait colors specify which attack type they can gain RALLY dies from. BLUE = Friendly Attack Rolls. RED = Opposing Attack Rolls. GREEN = All Attack Rolls. When a character gains a RALLY die, place a die with the matching result on their card.)

Comments
September 21, 2021
Skeleman
I'm torn between this one and the animated series one. Animated starts with flurry and stealth, but is more points. This one has exploit and guaranteed 5 damage if you can get a rally die but is much weaker defensively.
August 24, 2021
burleigh2
This has the same problem as the Wolverine from this set... 17 Toughness (although Creed's defense goes down at the end). He's got huge potential for damage, but as soon as he gets a rally die, he's going to die fast. I'd so much rather have most any recent Sabretooth than this one.
July 24, 2021
Goop
This guy looks scary good. A guarantee for a 5 on BCF that you can combine with exploit weakness. Add in his high attack values and flurry down the dial and he's a nasty piece for just 60pts. A little squishy though with only 17toughness to keep him up.
May 30, 2021
DarkTortoise23
[QUOTE=outbanks;12138708]Wizkids: We're changing the rules and powers to make the game simpler, and less intimidating to new players.

Also wizkids: Rally[/QUOTE] I mean I think the problem is Rally is a lot more complicated in writing than it is in practice. For everyone we've seen so far it boils down to "if theres a 5 in an enemy attack roll you can put a 5 on this card to use for something later" and that can be a game changer. With this Sabertooth it's a guaranteed 5 damage, for the colossus they showed, it's a guaranteed success on his impervious roll when you need it most. I think that if its implemented well and/or they figure out how to word it easier it could be a fun mechanic.
May 27, 2021
outbanks
